Pre-Game Insights: The 41st match of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2022 will see Bangladesh take on Pakistan at the Adelaide Oval in Adelaide on Sunday, November 6.
Pakistan have bounced back with two convincing performances with the ball and are still in with a chance of making the semi-finals.
Bangladesh have also won two out of their four matches, with notable performances from Litton Das and Taskin Ahmed.
Pakistan will start as the clear favorites but will be wary of Bangladesh's capabilities in white-ball cricket.
Adelaide Oval has been a relatively high-scoring venue with the average first-innings total being 164.
Both pacers and spinners have enjoyed the conditions at Adelaide Oval, accounting for more than 10 wickets across four matches.
Batting first has been the preferred choice at Adelaide Oval with the record heavily skewed in favor of teams batting first.
No injury concerns for both Bangladesh and Pakistan.
Mohammad Rizwan has a brilliant record against Bangladesh, scoring 242 runs in six matches at an average of 60.50.
Shakib Al Hasan's last T20I fifty came against Pakistan earlier in the month.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is set to take place at 9:30 AM IST and will be broadcasted exclusively on Star Sports and live-streamed on Hotstar.
Matches won by teams batting first at Adelaide Oval: 4
Matches won by teams bowling first at Adelaide Oval: 0
